headline.seo: L.S.U. All-American Tyrann Mathieu Discusses Transferring

docs.snippet: McNeese State Coach Matt Viator said he had met with the former Louisiana State all-American Tyrann Mathieu, who has not decided if he will transfer there after L.S.U. dropped him from its team....
docs.lead_paragraph: McNeese State Coach Matt Viator said he had met with the former Louisiana State all-American Tyrann Mathieu, who has not decided if he will transfer there after L.S.U. dropped him from its team.

headline.print_headline: Racial Profiling Rife at Airport, U.S. Officers Say
headline.seo: Racial Profiling at Boston Airport, Officials Say
headline.main: Racial Profiling Rife at Airport, U.S. Officers Say

docs.snippet: Officers in an airport program intended to spot telltale mannerisms of potential terrorists say the operation has become a magnet for racial profiling....
docs.abstract: Officers working as part of the Transportation Security Administration’s program to spot telltale mannerisms of potential terrorists say the operation has become a magnet for racial profiling; Logan International Airport officers in Boston assert that passengers who fit certain profiles, like Hispanics traveling to Miami or blacks wearing baseball caps backward, are much more likely to be stopped, searched and questioned for suspect behavior.

byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and ERIC LICHTBLAU

docs.lead_paragraph: Officers in an airport program intended to spot telltale mannerisms of potential terrorists say the operation has become a magnet for racial profiling.

headline.main: Gold for Bolt, Farah and the U.S. Women

docs.snippet: The Jamaicans won the 4x100-meter relay, and host Britain added another gold of its own on the track....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Jamaicans won the 4x100-meter relay, and host Britain added another gold of its own on the track.

headline.print_headline: A Team That Seems Comfortable With the Contrasts
headline.seo: Romney and Ryan Don’t Mind Their Contrasts
headline.main: In Romney and Ryan, a Pair Who Don’t Mind Their Differences

docs.snippet: Paul Ryan acknowledged that he would fill a void on the ticket, serving as the energetic Beltway yin to Mitt Romney’s experienced corporate yang....
docs.abstract: Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan's differences in background and style seem more pronounced than their similarities, but aides to Romney say that those distinctions are precisely what they consider part of Ryan's appeal.
docs.lead_paragraph: Paul Ryan acknowledged that he would fill a void on the ticket, serving as the energetic Beltway yin to Mitt Romney’s experienced corporate yang.

headline.print_headline: Three Players Suspended For Conspiring to Cheat
headline.seo: Chess: Feller, Hauchard and Marzolo Are Suspended
headline.main: Three Players Suspended for Conspiring to Cheat

docs.snippet: The punishments handed down for Sébastien Feller, Arnaud Hauchard and Cyril Marzolo of France close the books on one of the most notorious cheating scandals in the game’s history....
docs.abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column notes that World Chess Federation has suspended top French players Sebastien Feller, Arnaud Hauchard and Cyril Marzolo for cheating in 2010 tournaments as part of a conspiracy to help Feller win games.
docs.lead_paragraph: The punishments handed down for Sébastien Feller, Arnaud Hauchard and Cyril Marzolo of France close the books on one of the most notorious cheating scandals in the game’s history.

headline.print_headline: Jean Merrill, 89, a Writer Of Children’s Underdog Tales
headline.seo: Jean Merrill, Children’s Book Writer, Dies at 89
headline.main: Jean Merrill, a Writer of Children’s Underdog Tales, Dies at 89

docs.snippet: In “The Pushcart War,” “The Toothpaste Millionaire” and many other books, Ms. Merrill’s characters overcome the odds....
docs.abstract: Jean Merrill, children’s author best known for her 1964 book The Pushcart War, dies at age 89.
docs.lead_paragraph: In “The Pushcart War,” “The Toothpaste Millionaire” and many other books, Ms. Merrill’s characters overcome the odds.

headline.print_headline: Martin Fleischmann, Seeker of Cold Fusion, Dies at 85
headline.seo: Martin Fleischmann, Cold Fusion Seeker, Dies at 85
headline.main: Martin Fleischmann, Seeker of Cold Fusion, Dies at 85

docs.snippet: Mr. Fleischmann believed he had achieved cold fusion in a lab, but his announcement proved premature and he was discredited....
docs.abstract: Martin Fleischmann, scientist who pursued cold fusion in hopes of solving the world's energy needs, dies at age 85.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Fleischmann believed he had achieved cold fusion in a lab, but his announcement proved premature and he was discredited.

headline.print_headline: On Pittsburgh And the Peace Sign
headline.main: On Pittsburgh and the Peace Sign

docs.snippet: The dancer-choreographer Kyle Abraham is taking August easy, but he’s planning a busy fall....

docs.lead_paragraph: The dancer-choreographer Kyle Abraham is taking August easy, but he’s planning a busy fall.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Women Run Away With 5th Straight Gold
headline.seo: U.S. Women Win Fifth Straight Gold Medal in Basketball
headline.main: U.S. Women Run Away With 5th Straight Gold

docs.snippet: The United States women’s basketball team won its fifth straight gold medal with an 86-50 victory in the final, behind 21 points from Candace Parker....
docs.abstract: United States women’s basketball team wins its fifth straight gold medal with an 86-50 victory over France.
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States women’s basketball team won its fifth straight gold medal with an 86-50 victory in the final, behind 21 points from Candace Parker.
